title: Senior Account Executive
content:
Who we are:
The Lacek Group is a collection of brilliant, passionate, intellectually curious, and unique people who work on the leading edge of customer engagement. We come to work every day to help our clients build longer-lasting, more profitable customer relationships. We listen, collaborate and celebrate together. We treat each other with kindness and respect. And we believe different perspectives drive innovation, fuel creativity and make our business and communities better. 
 
Together with our parent company Ogilvy, one of the most creative and effective agencies in the world, we believe diversity drives smarter work for our clients — and better business for us. We believe inclusion is essential, and we welcome all who are ready to join our push for positive change. Every single day. 
 
What we need:
We currently have a great opportunity for a Senior Account Executive to join our team supporting a high-profile client. You'll use your experience in loyalty marketing to help grow Lacek's role with our client. This includes articulating and supporting our client's marketing strategy, branding activities and managing member rewards and experiences. As a Senior Account Executive, you'll bring the best thinking that the agency can offer to your client contacts, defining and managing marketing projects to ensure that they are delivered to our client as scoped – on time and on budget.
 
What you’ll do:

Provide direction/guidance to the creative team in the development of email and push notification campaigns 
Lead client reviews and communicate feedback to internal teams 
Prepare email, app and push assets for deployment according to project schedules 
Partner closely with a third-party email service provider to ensure emails are QAd and deployed successfully 
Assist with campaign testing, according to project schedules to ensure logic, design, copy and links are correct and communicate change requests as needed 
Assist with ad-hoc projects, from loading content to researching trends and competitors 
Drive efficient internal and client meetings by creating and distributing agendas in advance and meeting summaries afterwards 
Independently create and maintain project schedules for assigned projects. 
Effectively use program management tools to move projects through the agency in accordance with established processes  
Proactively seek information to understand campaign objectives and client direction 
Build credibility and nurture relationships with internal team members and client contacts with proactive communication 
Maintain client status reports   
Contribute content and lead Monthly Planning Meetings with the client
Nurture mid-manager-level client relationships
Identify new revenue growth or efficiency opportunities
Mentor and coach junior Account Executives

 
What you’ll bring:

Bachelor’s degree in related field such as marketing 
Minimum intermediate level PC skills required; Microsoft Office products preferred 
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to function within a team-oriented environment; must be an assertive participant 
Demonstrated ability to function independently, must be self-motivated 
Excellent time management skills, as well as the ability to effectively establish priorities and manage multiple projects 
Exercises good judgment and seeks guidance when outcomes are uncertain 
Must possess a high level of stress tolerance/flexibility, and maintain a high energy level 
Aptitude for story-telling and influencing 
Experience leading targeted lifecycle communications (or interest in learning) 

 
Competencies you’ll demonstrate:

Agency Citizenship
Adaptability
Building Client Relationships
Building Trust
Follow-up
Gaining Commitment
Stress Tolerance
Technical/Professional Knowledge & Skills

 
You’ll love working at The Lacek Group – smart people, great environment, engaging culture, comprehensive benefits and fantastic growth opportunities.  Your confidential inquiry is encouraged.
 
The Lacek Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer
 
#LI-RW1
 



At Ogilvy, our people are at the heart of what we do: a creative agency that sparks game-changing ideas across culture and business through collaboration, integrity, and a celebration of self-expression. 
We believe in building powerful teams with purpose. This means hiring and nurturing talent across all races, ethnicities, religions, abilities, sexual orientation, and gender identities – and we relentlessly curate transformative initiatives that make our commitment to fairness, and equity a reality. 
Our ultimate mission is to leave a positive impact on the world, creating a better future for all, while supporting and uplifting the global communities we serve.  This is central to our mantra of Borderless Creativity.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Please indicate the state where you intend to perform work for the company.
